page.title: 19INTERVIEW WITH HIGHAM OAP
page.content: MR DYSON SAID THAT WHEN HE WAS SMALL,WHERE THE SHOP IS NOW,THERE WAS A CO-OP,NEXT DOOR WAS A BUTCHERS, BEHIND THE 4 ALES PUB,A NEWSAGENTS , WHERE LANESIDE AVENUE IS,A GREEN GROCERS AND THERE WAS ANOTHER BUTCHERS AND A FISH SHOP AND CAFE. MR DYSON GOT CHRISTENED,CONFIRMED AND MARRIED IN HIGHAM CHURCH AND HAS LIVED THERE ALL HIS LIFE. MRS.BILLOWS SAID AT THE OLD SCHOOL, AT CHRISTMAS,THERE WAS NO FATHER CHRISTMAS.BUT THEY HAD A CHRISTMAS PARTY AND IN JANUARY THERE WAS A BIG TEA PARTY,WHERE THE CHILDREN COULD EAT AS MUCH AS THEY WANTED. FOR CHRISTMAS THEY GOT,IN THEIR STOCKING,A THREEPENNY BIT,AN APPLE AND ORANGE,A QUARTER POUND BOX OF CHOCOLATES,A HANKY,SOMETIMES A BOOK AND A SMALL TOY. TRHINGS HAVE CHANGED A BIT SINCE THEN!
